newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil exports $206 mln a day in August third week.
newsitem.headline: Brazil exports $206 mln a day in August third week.

text.p: Brazil exported an average of $206 million of goods per day in the third week of August, said Mauricio Cortes, secretary of foreign trade at the Ministry of Industry and Commerce.

Cortes, speaking to reporters at the announcement of a $334 million trade deficit for the month of July, did not give a total figure for exports in August's third week, but a ministry spokeswoman confirmed the week had five days, giving exports a total value of $1.03 billion.
In the first two weeks of the month exports totalled $1.468 billion, with a daily average of $209.7 million.
